Article.ArticleTitle: [The National Pharmacopoeia and the therapeutic status of flora in Mexican biomedicine].

AbstractText: The paper analyses the transformation of the Mexican pharmacopoeia, focusing on the presence of medicinal plants. Reflecting diverse processes, editions of the pharmacopoeia show a progressive modification in its content and profile. A text written to shape a Mexican materia medica, recognising empirical knowledge by the inclusion of popularly used resources and involving clinicians as authors and recipients, was transformed into a mainly industrial publication with no clinical references. The origin and implications of this process are explored.

AffiliationInfo.Affiliation: Instituto Nacional de Antropología e Historia. Museo de Medicina Tradicional y Herbolaria y Proyecto Actores Sociales de la Flora Medicinal en México. leon@dunsun.cti.uaem.mx

Article.VernacularTitle: La Farmacopea Nacional y el estatuto terapéutico de la flora en la biomedicina mexicana.
